intro: Hieracium lainzii, commonly known as the Lainz hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often lobed. Its yellow flowers bloom in summer, and the plant is adapted to rocky and well-drained soils. Hieracium lainzii is often found in alpine meadows and is considered a characteristic species of its habitat.
